docs.lead_paragraph: Following are excerpts from domestic Polish radio and television broadcasts as transcribed and translated from the Polish by the Foreign Broadcast Information Service here: On Censorship 9:10 P.M. Tuesday (3:10 P.M. Tuesday, E.S.T.) The Ministry of Communications informs of the following curtailment of services: In the postal sector, the acceptance of domestic parcels is suspended, with the exception of drugs, means and objects essential for the saving of life and health and parcels of food and clothing. Parcels should be unsealed, making it possible for the contents to be examined. Domestic postal packets containing books, press and printed matter destined for abroad are suspended. Food parcels from abroad will be handled according to the previous procedure.

headline.main: EXCERPTS FROM RADIO AND TELEVISION BROADCASTS BY POLAND
